Package pr1.helper.core

Class AbstractApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • pr1.helper.core.AbstractApplication
  • public abstract class AbstractApplication
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for console and file-based applications.

    This abstract class provides automated setup and teardown of input/output resources. It standardizes the Locale to Locale.US, automatically executes the subclass-defined run() method after construction, and ensures that all open Closeable resources (e.g., FileReader, FileWriter) are properly closed after execution.

    Additionally, it provides convenient factory and wrapper methods for Scanner, PrintWriter, and PrintDecorator instances for both console and file output.

    Since:
    2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Benjamin Wagner
    See Also:
    FileReader, FileWriter, FileTarget, PrintDecorator, Scanner, PrintWriter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AbstractApplication()
      Initializes the default locale (Locale.US), calls run(), and ensures all open resources are closed afterward.

    • Method Detail

      • createFileReader

        public AbstractApplication createFileReader​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Creates a new FileReader instance using the current subclass package hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name located within the data directory of the subclass.
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent method chaining.
        See Also:
        FileReader

      • createFileReader

        public AbstractApplication createFileReader​(java.lang.Class<?> classname,
                                            java.lang.String fileName)
        Creates a new FileReader instance based on another class package hierarchy.

        Example:

        • pr1.a02.Schachbrett.class -> ./data/a02/
        • pr1.foobar.foo.bar.FooBar.class -> ./data/foobar/foo/bar/
        Parameters:
        classname - class whose package hierarchy determines the relative data path.
        fileName - file name located within the derived data path.
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent method chaining.
        See Also:
        FileReader, FileTarget

      • createFileWriter

        public AbstractApplication createFileWriter()
        Creates a new FileWriter using the subclass name as base file name, stored in the data directory.

        Example: pr1.a02.Schachbrett -> ./data/a02/schachbrett.txt

        Returns:
        this instance for fluent method chaining.
        See Also:
        FileWriter

      • createFileWriter

        public AbstractApplication createFileWriter​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Creates a new FileWriter with a freely chosen file name, stored in the data directory.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the file to be created.
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent method chaining.
        See Also:
        FileWriter, FileTarget

      • createFileWriter

        public AbstractApplication createFileWriter​(FileTarget target,
                                            java.lang.String fileName)
        Creates a new FileWriter with a custom FileTarget and file name.

        Example: FileTarget.DATA_DIR, pr1.a02.Schachbrett.class -> ./data/a02/[filename]

        Parameters:
        target - base directory as defined in FileTarget.
        fileName - name of the file to be created.
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent method chaining.
        See Also:
        FileWriter, FileTarget

      • withInputScanner

        public void withInputScanner​(java.util.function.Consumer<java.util.Scanner> closure)
        Executes a Consumer function with the current Scanner with given input data.

        The scanner must be initialized beforehand; otherwise, the closure will not be executed.

        Parameters:
        closure - lambda function that processes the Scanner.
        See Also:
        Scanner

      • withInputScanner

        public void withInputScanner​(java.lang.String input,
                             java.util.function.Consumer<java.util.Scanner> closure)
        Executes a Consumer function with a new instance of Scanner and given input data.

        The scanner will be instantiated and initialized automatically with given input.

        Parameters:
        input - given input data.
        closure - lambda function that processes the Scanner.
        See Also:
        Scanner

      • withFileScanner

        public void withFileScanner​(java.util.function.Consumer<java.util.Scanner> closure)
        Executes a Consumer function with the current Scanner from FileReader.

        The file reader must be initialized beforehand; otherwise, the closure will not be executed.

        Parameters:
        closure - lambda function that processes the Scanner.
        See Also:
        FileReader, Scanner

      • withFileScanner

        public void withFileScanner​(java.lang.String filename,
                            java.util.function.Consumer<java.util.Scanner> closure)
        Overload: executes closure for a specific file name in the subclass data path.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the file to read from within the subclass data directory.
        closure - lambda function that processes the Scanner.
        See Also:
        FileReader

      • withFileScanner

        public void withFileScanner​(java.lang.Class<?> classname,
                            java.lang.String filename,
                            java.util.function.Consumer<java.util.Scanner> closure)
        Overload: executes closure for a specific class and file path.
        Parameters:
        classname - the class used to resolve the package-based subdirectory.
        filename - name of the file to read from within the derived data path.
        closure - lambda function that processes the Scanner.
        See Also:
        FileReader

        Closes the FileWriter if open.

      • run

        public abstract void run()
        Abstract entry point method that must be implemented by subclasses.

        It is automatically called by the constructor after initialization.
